intro: Micranthella orbignyana, commonly known as the orbignyana bellflower, is a perennial herb native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Its flowering period occurs during the spring and early summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
